action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = inbox
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: none of the letters in "apple" are in the target word, so I will choose a word with completely different letters.
guess: brick

attempts = 2
target_word = inbox
guess = brick
guess_feedback = b<yellow> r<red> i<yellow> c<red> k<red>

guess_feedback: b<yellow> r<red> i<yellow> c<red> k<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "b" and "i" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will try a new word that includes these letters in different positions.
guess: bison

attempts = 3
target_word = inbox
guess = bison
guess_feedback = b<yellow> i<yellow> s<red> o<green> n<yellow>

guess_feedback: b<yellow> i<yellow> s<red> o<green> n<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "b", "i", and "n" are in the word but in the wrong positions, and "o" is in the correct position. I will rearrange these letters and try a new word.
guess: inbox

attempts = 4
target_word = inbox
guess = inbox
guess_feedback = i<green> n<green> b<green> o<green> x<green>

guess_explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
none of the letters in "apple" are in the target word, so I will choose a word with completely different letters.
"b" and "i" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will try a new word that includes these letters in different positions.
"b", "i", and "n" are in the word but in the wrong positions, and "o" is in the correct position. I will rearrange these letters and try a new word.
